org.aoplib4j.testing.internal
Class JUnitAspect

java.lang.Object
  org.aoplib4j.testing.internal.AbstractTestingAspect
      org.aoplib4j.testing.internal.JUnitAspect

public final class JUnitAspect
extends AbstractTestingAspect

Aspect implementation for the JUnit(3 and 4) framework. For every executed test, the aspect will intercept any JUnit assertion violation and will throw them at the end of the test execution (before tearDown).

Author:
Adrian Citu

Method Detail

assertCallPointcut

public void assertCallPointcut()
Abstract pointcut representing the call of a assert method. Pointcut representing the call of all the JUnit (3 or 4) assert* methods. 
  AspectJ pointcut:
  call(static public void junit.framework.Assert+.assert*(..))

Specified by:
assertCallPointcut in class AbstractTestingAspect

executionOfTestMethodPointcut

public void executionOfTestMethodPointcut()
Pointcut representing the execution of a test method. Every child aspect should write the pointcut proper to his own way of executing tests. Pointcut representing the execution of any JUni4 or JUnit3 test method. 
 AspectJ pointcut:
  execution(public void junit.framework.TestCase+.test*())
   || execution(@org.junit.Test * * ())

Specified by:
executionOfTestMethodPointcut in class AbstractTestingAspect
See Also:
executionOfTestMethodPointcut()

assertCallAdvice

public void assertCallAdvice(org.aspectj.lang.ProceedingJoinPoint pjp)
                      throws java.lang.Throwable
Abstract method representing the advice for the AbstractTestingAspect.assertCallPointcut(). Normally the child aspects should use the Around advice to implement the behavior arround the call of the assert methods. Advice that executed around the call of assert methods. The advice executes the assertion and catch the AssertionFailedError(for JUnit3) or AssertionError (for JUnit4) if any and computes and keep the error stack trace for later use.

Specified by:
assertCallAdvice in class AbstractTestingAspect
Parameters:
pjp - object created by the AspectJ framework.
Throws:
java.lang.Throwable - the exception that can be thrown by the ProceedingJoinPoint.proceed() execution.

assertFail

public void assertFail(java.lang.String message)
Fails a test with the given message. Every child aspect should use the proper assert class or another mechanism to mark a test failure. Implementation using the JUnit Assert.fail(String).

Specified by:
assertFail in class AbstractTestingAspect
Parameters:
message - the assertion error message.
See Also:
AbstractTestingAspect.assertFail( java.lang.String)
